topic.title: How do I run ZeroNet with docker and Tor?
topic.body: I want to support network and host own zsite. Just I want to use docker and runn all traffic via Tor Network.

topic.title: How to I fix 0 trackers issue?
ZeroNet and SSH tunnel
topic.body: Has anyone tried to run ZeroNet on separate machine and create SSH tunnel to access it on remote machine?

topic.title: Is there any Dark Theme for ZeroNet?
Do users of v2 Tor can see v3 users on ZeroNet?
Why Zeronet on Tor v3 patch drops tracker to 0 randomly?
To people that uses PeerTube!
topic.body:
Hello everyone!
I have question for you is PeerTube distribute data across instances or it's just stored on single server?

topic.title: Message to people running Tor v3 trackers.
topic.body:
Hello guys!
There was guide on how to run Tor v3 tracker on Ubuntu 20.04. Issue is that it's not the best idea modtly cause if you use tor package installed from APT you will get outdated package (about 1 years old). What I recomend is to update Ubuntu to 21.10 and update Tor. That makes my tracker run very stable and always 100% sucess. PS: You can check Tor version by using ```apt install nyx``` , after running nyx it should show you on top if you have recomended version. Thank you.

1614952464_15PBP7E1m1G82N5r5AoXUFMinSuqD.body: I use Tor and I2P but I'm giving Zeronet a try.

> [styromaniac](#comment_3008_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Hopefully you're using ZeroNet with Tor, if you care to remain purely pseudonymous.

Tor with ZeroNet is slow but it works. Though some websites have problems with content.json not being downloaded.

1628149781_1AmXimBQuPemuoTM9NFYg9Mn5YY6H.body: ZeroNet is cool but lack development

> [gitcenter](#comment_1506_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): 9 users posted at least one comment on ZeroTalk during the last 24 hours.27 users posted at least one comment during the last week.82 users posted at least one comment during the last month. [...]

What I like is that ZeroNet distributes websites across nodes, but without new updates and futures it's just dies :(

> [gitcenter](#comment_1508_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): From my point of view, what keeps ZeroNet alive is the content. Lots of blogs, forums and chats, lots of websites that are still alive and accessible without web.archive.org.

Umm I could not found much zsites :(

1628848642_15Ef8fbH5j5WZuMNoKum5u6WYFguX.body:
> [zeroseed6e](#comment_25_17NZ2BiZ1HUYppUcUmU5bgyGkp8kH7UyXj): In my opinion i2p and ipfs are not Easy to use and advanced ad zeronet.

IPFS is bad. But would love to see mix of ZeroNet and I2P cause that would allow anonymus torrenting :)

1629098773_1JTx34tPsJsZT8WWGEih4c8kxeY2k.body:
> [gitcenter](#comment_1517_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Yes. [...]

How do you managed to do this cause for me often it gives me connections errors.

> [gitcenter](#comment_1517_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Yes. [...]
My plan is to run Zeronet on my server in LAN network where I have lot of storage for seeding.
+ Everything should work only using Tor.

> [gitcenter](#comment_1518_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Do you mean the 'Connection with UiServer Websocket was lost. Reconnecting...' error? Does it happen every, say, 10 seconds, or is it less stable than that? [...]

Direct connection both machines are in that same local network :)
Zeronet is running inside docker.

> [gitcenter](#comment_1520_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Wait, on a second thought, if the machines are in the same local network, why do you even need ssh port forwarding? Can't you just use http://whateverothermachineipis:43110 to use ZeroNet?

Issue is that most people link 127.0.0.1 links on diffrent places. Would need to change IP everytime I go to new website.

> [gitcenter](#comment_1521_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): M'kay. Then you can do that locally. Put a script to redirect 127.0.0.1:43110 to whateverothermachineipis:43110. That seems like a simpler and a more efficient solution to me than a full-blown ssh proxy. [...]

Ah sadly my main machine runs Windows :/

> [gitcenter](#comment_1522_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): socat can be built for Windows too. By the by, your problems with ssh proxy could be because of your OS; ssh doesn't work exactly well under Windows from my experience.

Using Putty :)

> [swashbuckler](#comment_87_13UJZwpkQASN9unpc9hLhmwyauXzzatQgQ): Nope, but you can download https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet-win/archive/dist-win64/ZeroNet-py3-win64.zip, unpack it. Then download https://github.com/zeronet-enhanced/ZeroNet/archive/refs/heads/massive-rework.zip and unpack it into the core dir of original folder, replacing files. Should work in theory :) I'm running it under Win10 without .exe file, but that require python 3.9 installed on your machine, along with some Visual c++ compilator tools deps. [...]

Testing sending message from forked version :)

Then download https://github.com/zeronet-enhanced/ZeroNet/archive/refs/heads/massive-rework.zip and unpack it into the core dir of original folder, replacing files. Should work in theory :) I'm running it under Win10 without .exe file, but that require python 3.9 installed on your machine, along with some Visual c++ compilator tools deps. [...]

As long both network can talk with each others it should be fine.

> [xanadu](#comment_70_1JTx34tPsJsZT8WWGEih4c8kxeY2kk89gH): You can test mine zero://agufghdtniyfwty3wk55drxxwj2zxgzzo7dbrtje73gmvcpxy4ngs4ad.onion:15441

You can also send me message via Zero Mail :)

If you get 0 tracker issue with ZeroNet Tor v3 try execute 
```curl --socks5-hostname 127.0.0.1:9050 https://check.torproject.org/```
For me it helped with tor connection cause something was blocking zeronet reaching Onion network.
I made important discovery Ubuntu 20.04 have outdated Tor binarry! Check it if you have issues with unstable trackers.

1637164951_1FmMvcMgGyFnWtH3aSAHmaxwedbBR.body:
> [6283822](#comment_131_12sCaEUFqE6g3JrDqmEA8pn9yrgxwkZQMe): when zeronet.now.im is active, it grabbed as almost 45000+ seed for ZeroHello and 40000+ for ZeroNet Mobile. But don't know the reason, it was done few days back. To test this congestion I created a public proxy my self here http://zerolink.ml. ZeroNet is being used by people around world and more to come in coming days. Major issues are portability and lack of proper strategy in data sharing between peers. Due to this there are data lose issues occurred here and there.

For me is hard to find peers after switching to v3 patch. Trackers droping sometimes to 0. I use Syncronite.

> [xcape2net](#comment_1000_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): I also use Syncronite.  With the V3 patch, I'm seeing about half as many trackers as I was a month ago without the patch. However, the number of peers I'm seeing is about the same as a month ago.

For me is like 3-5 trackers active and about 80-110 peers

1637214620_1PxcegJ1mKoMHeS73f9MvXeUWDq8B.body: Yes we need team not just single person :)

> [obrien1984](#comment_17_14a6MrpmfdWZ9543vTNP8Co6Fa4S7M9Mq9): what if the 3 owners all go like nofish? same situation.

Then another person will fork ZeroNet again :D xd

1637248722_1JTx34tPsJsZT8WWGEih4c8kxeY2k.body:
> [killerwhale905](#comment_8_1PB1YKkXjDp7fy4WC1bB9iw6V9Hp2thxWN): "Videos are made available via HTTP to download, but playback favors a peer-to-peer playback using HLS and WebTorrent. Users connected to the platform act as relay points that send pieces of video to other users,[7] lessening the bandwidth of each to the server and thus allowing smaller hardware to operate at a lower cost."  [...]

I think it's that P2P is only when 2 or more people watch the video but not when you upload video to one instance. From my point of view video stay on instance you uploaded and not being distributed to other instances. So when instance X goes offline your content is gone.
